# DFplyr

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of DFplyr is to enable `dplyr` support for `S4Vectors::DataFrame`.

## Installation

You can install the development version from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("jonocarroll/DFplyr")
```
## Examples

```{r}
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(S4Vectors)
  library(dplyr)
  library(DFplyr)
})

m <- mtcars[, c("cyl", "hp", "am", "gear", "disp")]
DF <- as(m, "DataFrame")
DF

d <- add_dplyr_compat(DF)
d

mutate(d, newvar = cyl + hp)

mutate_at(d, vars(starts_with("c")), ~.^2)

group_by(d, cyl, am)

group_by(d, cyl, am) %>%
  tally(gear)

count(d, gear, am, cyl)

select(d, am, cyl)

select(d, am, cyl) %>%
  rename(foo = am)

arrange(d, desc(hp))

rbind(data.frame(m[1, ], row.names = "MyCar"), DF) %>%
  add_dplyr_compat() %>%
  distinct()

# filter(d, am == 0) ## broken

slice(d, 3:6)
```
